thread.title: Britney Spears 'hits back' at with bible verse
thread.title_full: Britney Spears 'hits back' at Katy Perry with bible verse | Daily Mail Online

author: Jabeen Waheed For Mailonline
title: Britney Spears 'hits back' at with bible verse
text:
Her fans were left unimpressed after Katy Perry threw shade at her for her 2007 shaved head incident.
And now Britney Spears has seemingly hit back at the Roar songstress for her 'offensive' comments at Sunday night's Grammy Awards .
The 35-year-old pop icon took to Twitter to share the bible verse: 'Her mouth speaks from that which fills her heart (heart emoji) Luke 6:45,' prompting her fans to believe she's blasting the brunette beauty.
Scroll down for video
Clapping back: Britney Spears, 35, has seemingly hit back at Katy Perry for her 'shaved head' comment at Sunday night's Grammy Awards with a bible verse
The verse, which seemed to indirectly call Katy cold-hearted for her comments, was also affixed with a picture of someone's hands cupped around the sun.
And Twittersphere went wild with Britney's fans claiming the message was 'throwing shade' at Katy.
'QUEEN OF SHADE!!,' celebrity blogger Perez Hilton tweeted, while another user shared: 'Wow shading katy through a bible verse, holy queen!
'What a classy way to put someone in their place!!!! while another tweeted: 'She's so humble and descreet a queen
'Omg the shade I LIVE!', while another fan enthused:
Britney's discreet clap back started after Katy raised eyebrows by referencing the Womanizer's head shaving incident in 2007, in the midst of a very public breakdown.
'Her mouth speaks from that which fills her heart': The verse, which seemed to indirectly call Katy cold-hearted for her comments, was also affixed with a picture of someone's hands cupped around the sun
Controversial comment: Britney's discreet clap back started after Katy raised eyebrows during Sunday night's Grammys by referencing the Womanizer's head shaving incident in 2007, in the midst of a very public breakdown
Sparkle in sequins by Tom Ford this season £2140 Tom Ford embellished top
Complete the look below
Buy now
The Grammy Awards are renowned for their stand out performances, a bit of drama and of course a killer red carpet.
And when it came to the clothes last night's event certainly didn't disappoint. Adele rocked Givenchy, Jennifer Lopez looked lush in lilac by Ralph & Russo, Chrissy Teigen was sultry in Roberto Cavalli and Rihanna was stunning in Armani Privé.
And let's not forget Katy Perry who wore this ensemble straight off the Tom Ford AW16 catwalk. We love the feather maxi skirt which was styled with a long sequinned tunic top complete with long sleeves and high neck.
Embellishment is always the quickest way to achieve a glamorous look so why not copy Katy this season? Click (right) to snap up her top and you can buy the skirt below too. Or just sparkle in sequins with one of the tops in our edit below.
MSGM, Asos and Boohoo will ensure you shine like an A-list star!

On Britney's side: Celebrity blogger Perez Hilton noticed the 'shade' thrown by the Born To Make You Happy singer
'Holy Queen': Another user tweeted the verse again to prove the point
Katy, who wore an attention-grabbing Tom Ford dress, had been explaining the long gap since her last album, 2014's Prism.
'There was a pause in the music for a little while,' queried E!'s Ryan Seacrest.
Replied Katy: 'Yeah that's called taking care of your mental health.'
'How'd that go?' he asked, leading to Katy's apparent reference to Britney: 'Fantastic! And I haven't shaved my head yet,' she joked.
And Twitter didn't take it well with many sticking up for Britney for indirectly attacking her mental health.
'Classy': One Twitter user commended Britney for the way she handled the situation
'Kill her with kindness': Other fans also applauded the pop icon for the way she hit back at the Roar songstress
'I haven't shaved my head yet!' Katy had been explaining the long gap since her last album, 2014's Prism when she made the dig at Britney
Not impressed: Fans did not like Katy's reference to Britney Spear's breakdown
'Tragic' They felt the dig was not needed
Meawhile, the 32-year-old also discussed her upcoming new album.
'I’m so proud of it. I think it’s a new era of me. I call it an era of purposeful thought,' she said of her political new track Chained to the Rhythm, which dropped on Friday.
'All of my songs have always had layers to them. I used to be kind of the queen of innuendos and I woke up and educated myself more and I think I’m maybe more the queen of subtext and I think it’s a song that starts conversations. And I think we need to listen to each other.'
Katy's bold appearance at the Grammys came after she said she had 'given up' caring what people think about her style.
Moving on: Fans blasted Katy for 'throwing shade' at Britney's mental breakdown
New music: The 32-year-old also discussed her upcoming new album, revealing one of her favourite new tracks is called Bon Appetit
Admitting that she used to spend hours reading her followers' comments about her appearance and clothes on social media, she now only listens to her closest friends now.
She said: 'I've given up on what people think about me.
'I have a great group of people around me that I listen to and value their opinions.
'I gave up scrolling down on the comments. Fashion is a way to express yourself.
'We can say we're funny or romantic or serious or sarcastic just by how we display ourselves.'
Getting ready: Katy posted an Instagram showing her make-up artist using her Covergirl range
